metadata.title: CVE-2020-15677 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
By exploiting an Open Redirect vulnerability on a website, an attackercould have spoofed the site displayed in the download file dialog to showthe original site (the one suffering from the open redirect) rather thanthe site the file was actually downloaded from. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 81, Thunderbird < 78.3, and Firefox ESR < 78.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
